body.p: On the Lying Prophets.
Therefore thus says the Lord God; because
you have spoken vanity, and seen lies,
therefore, behold, I am against you, says
the Lord God, and my hand shall be upon
the prophets that see vanity, and that
divine lies; they shall not be in the
assembly of my people, neither shall
they be written in the writing of the
house of Israel, neither shall they
enter into the land of Israel, and
Joy shall know that I am thy Lord
God. Ezekiel XIII. 889.

Various are the ways practiced by seducers
of all times, and chiefly by such who proposed
themselves to seduce the people of God; the most
dangerous, however, were such as begun with their
preaching, of a pretended improving of hearts and
reason of mankind; disguising as much as possible,
their irreligious conduct, and the real feelings
of their depraved heart.

I. O. begun likwise with his sermon on the
mount, saying: Thank not that I am come to destroy

but to fulfil; for verily, I say unto you, till heaven
and earth past one jot or one little shall in no wise
past from the law till all be fulfilled.

He and her disciples ended with the abolition
of nearly all, the precepts taught by Moses and
the prophets.

Honored Sir:

This is followed by several lines which I
desire to see included in the “Occident.” That is,
provided you consider them worthwhile for the
public. I am convinced of my weakness in
the English language inasmuch as I am
in this land only a few months. I have no
doubt that you will have to make some
changes in this and I shall be delighted
to have you do it if necessary.

And now, dear Sir, act according to your
wisdom for I rejoice over your words greatly
and am convinced that your recompense
is very great. It is a righteous war
that you are conducting, and God will
strengthen and hearten and bless you
and make for you a name among the
great men of the earth. And when you
come to your eternal reward, you
will know that you have sown
righteousness and it has borne fruit
Your faithful servant

(The enclosed Sermon speaks for itself. It is
directed against the “misleading arguments”
of the reformers. The Hebrew quotations need
not be translated for any particular
reason. The last page, in Hebrew, adds
nothing to what the English says, and
may have been written in that language
because the preacher was better able to
express himself in this way).
